# Bubble charts {#sec-bubble-charts} ::: {.callout-tip appearance='simple' icon=false} ***This graph is largely complete and just needs final proof reading.*** ::: :::: {.callout-note collapse="false" icon=false}
::: {.cell layout-align="right"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](bubble_charts_files/figure-html/full_code_display-1.png){fig-align='right' width=60% height=60%} ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.10em; color: #02577A;"} **This graph requires:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ three numeric (continuous) variables** ::: :::: ## Description Bubble graphs display relationships between three numeric (continuous) variables. The position on the `x` and `y` axis illustrates the relationship between the first two variables, and the `size` of the point (i.e., the bubble) conveys the numeric value of the third. ## Set up ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **PACKAGES:** ::: Install packages. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} install.packages("palmerpenguins") library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **DATA:** ::: ::: {.column-margin} ![Artwork by allison horst](www/lter_penguins.png){fig-align="right" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: The `penguins` data. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins glimpse(penguins) #> Rows: 344 #> Columns: 8 #> $ species Adelie, Adelie, Adelie… #> $ island Torgersen, Torgersen, … #> $ bill_length_mm 39.1, 39.5, 40.3, NA, … #> $ bill_depth_mm 18.7, 17.4, 18.0, NA, … #> $ flipper_length_mm 181, 186, 195, NA, 193… #> $ body_mass_g 3750, 3800, 3250, NA, … #> $ sex male, female, female, … #> $ year 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007… ``` ::: ::: ## Grammar ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **CODE:** ::: - Create labels with `labs()` - Map `bill_length_mm` to `x` axis - Map `flipper_length_mm` to `y` axis - Map `body_mass_g` to `size` - Set `alpha` to `1/3` - Add `scale_size()`, set the `range` to `c(0.1, 10)` and `name` to `"Body Mass (g)"` - Move the legend to the bottom of the graph with `theme(legend.position = "bottom")` ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} labs_bubble <- labs( title = "Bill Length vs. Flipper Length", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Flipper length (mm)", size = "Body Mass (g)") ggp2_bubble <- penguins |> ggplot( aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) + geom_point(aes(size = body_mass_g), alpha = 1/3) + scale_size(range = c(.1, 10), name = "Body Mass (g)") + theme(legend.position = "bottom") ggp2_bubble + labs_bubble ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **GRAPH:** ::: ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](bubble_charts_files/figure-html/create_graph_bubble-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: :::
